intro: Potalia resinifera, commonly known as the resinous potalia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes other plants like the cashew and mango. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and produces yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer. One of its notable features is the secretion of a resinous substance from its bark, which has been used traditionally for various purposes. The resin is often collected and utilized in local crafts and traditional medicine.
